title: FileMgr
description: FileMgr is a powerful homebrew webOS service. It freely provides custom file management API for developers and is used by many apps and patches, most notably Internalz.

changes: Fixed issue preventing ipkg feed download of FileMgr
Patching is now done via AUSMT
Fixed patching, as the AUPT script URLs were accidentally changed
Improved support for larger resolution screens
Added query function for getting info on an array of files and directories
Fixed bug preventing proper filesize-based sorting
Improved functions to hide Internalz or Internalz Pro
Completely recoded into a Node.js javascript service and is now webOS 2.0 ready
Redesigned and updated frontend app
Service can now be fully uninstalled via orange+tap in launcher
Improved error handling
Added a public function to check if Internalz is installed
Rescans fileindexer after file/directory deletion
Much improved read/write functions
Minor bug fixes
Added image handler setting function for Internalz
Minor code cleanup
Improved text-file detection
Minor code cleanup
Fixed the rename/move/copy functions so it properly gets the fileindexer to rescan afterwards
Various minor bugfixes
Added special write/delete permissions for service calls originating from Internalz for its Master Mode
Implemented and debugged fat32 readonly attribute set/get functions
Implemented and debugged linux permissions set/get functions
Added subscription option for "read" function, for large files
FileIndexer now rescans after every rename, move, and copy action
Initial release
